Content.Text:
<NAME_EDDA>How is everyone doing? It's been so hot here
these last few days. I hope the weather has been
kinder to you.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh! Hello, <MYNAME>. I mustn't have heard you
come in.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I was just looking at this photograph of my son,
and I couldn't help but talk like he was here.
Happens all the time.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I can't put my finger on why, but you really
remind me of him, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, yes! Where are my manners? Please, sit
down and relax. I'll go brew us a spot of tea.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
That picture was taken before my son moved
out. That was a long time ago, now.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
He was born and raised here in this town.
Eventually, he married and had children of his
own. Ohoho... Here, these are my grandchildren.
<PAGE>
Those were wonderful days. All of us worked
together on the farm.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
My son never quite seemed to take to farm
work, though.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Eventually, he got a job at a big company in the
city and moved his whole family there.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Or at least, he tried to. His son loved this farm
and hated the thought of moving to the city, so
Grandpa and I took care of him for a while.
<PAGE>
For several years, he lived here with us.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
My grandson truly loved farm life. He was even
excited to help out with the chores!
<PAGE>
And once Grandpa passed on, he did a lot to
look after me.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>But my grandson had his own life to live, and it
wasn't fair to keep him cooped up here with me
forever.
<PAGE>
I spoke with my son about it and eventually, I
sent my grandson back to live with his family in
the city.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, don't worry dearie. My grandson is already
grown up. He understands now why we made
the decision we did.
<PAGE>
A few years ago, he sent me a letter about that.
He really has come into his own.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, yes! Here's a picture of him.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is the most recent picture he's sent me.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Here's one of my son's family. My grandson is
the one in front. They're all a happy family.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
When my grandson wrote to me, he said he'd
come back in a heartbeat if I ever felt lonely.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>And that's why I'll never tell him whether I am or
not. He has a wonderful life in the city. I don't
want to take that from him.
<PAGE>
And besides, I have my farm. I have you, Fritz
and all the good townsfolk. It's hard to get lonely
here!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, goodness me. I'm sorry, I've gone and
nattered your ear off. I didn't mean to take so
much of your time.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
But it was so good to chat with you, dear. Feel
free to drop in whenever you'd like.
